intro: Amsinckia tessellata, commonly known as the checkerberry, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, checkerboard-patterned leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a strong, aromatic scent. Amsinckia tessellata is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
